units.title: Aggregate formation
units.text: Place 3 mL of cell suspension per well into a 6‑well low‑attachment plate and incubate for 1 d until cell aggregates with smooth borders (>50‑ to 100‑µm diameter) have been formed (Fig. 2b).
units.rationale: Forms uniform hPSC aggregates required for downstream differentiation.

units.title: Mesoderm induction
units.text: Use a 10‑mL serological pipette to gently resuspend the aggregates (3 mL per well) in N2B27 medium + 12 µM CHIR99021 + 30 ng/mL BMP‑4 and transfer the aggregates back to the low‑attachment plate. Incubate the cells.
units.rationale: Activates WNT and BMP pathways to drive mesodermal fate.

units.title: Vascular lineage induction
units.text: Resuspend the aggregates (3 mL per well) in N2B27 medium + 100 ng/mL VEGF‑A + 2 µM forskolin and transfer the aggregates back to the low‑attachment plates. Incubate for 2 more days (Fig. 2c).
units.rationale: Stimulates endothelial and pericyte differentiation from mesoderm.

units.title: Embedding aggregates in collagen‑Matrigel
units.text: Add 0.5 mL of collagen I/Matrigel solution per 12‑well plate and swirl the plate equally to distribute the solution in the wells. Incubate the plate at 37 °C for 2 h for solidiﬁcation.
units.rationale: Provides a 3D matrix for vascular network sprouting.

units.title: Induce vessel sprouting
units.text: Add prewarmed (37 °C) StemPro‑34 SFM complete medium including 15 % FBS, 100 ng/mL VEGF‑A and 100 ng/mL FGF‑2 to induce blood vessel differentiation. Sprouting vessels should appear after 1–3 d after embedding.
units.rationale: Supplies growth factors that promote endothelial tube formation.

units.title: Medium change schedule
units.text: Change the medium after 3 d and then every other day.
units.rationale: Maintains nutrient supply and removes waste for healthy network growth.

units.title: Fix vascular networks
units.text: (i) Carefully aspirate the medium from a well using a P1000 pipette and add 4 % paraformaldehyde (PFA) solution in PBS for 20 min at room temperature.
units.rationale: Preserves network morphology for downstream staining.

units.title: Primary antibody staining
units.text: Add 50–100 µL of primary antibody diluted in blocking buffer (Table 1). Incubate vessel networks/organoids in an upright position on a rocking shaker at 4 °C overnight.
units.rationale: Labels specific cellular markers for imaging and analysis.

units.title: Transplantation into mice
units.text: Transplant blood vessel organoids into the kidney capsule of immunocompromised mice as previously described37. When transplanting, use one blood vessel organoid per kidney and transplant the entire blood vessel organoid (Fig. 4a).
units.rationale: Enables in vivo maturation and functional assessment of human vessels.

units.title: Perfusion assay
units.text: Injection of a high‑molecular‑weight dextran (70 kDa, magenta) intravenously marks perfused blood vessels.
units.rationale: Demonstrates functional blood flow through the transplanted vasculature.
